de.esoco.process.ui

Class UiLayout.Cell

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.esoco.process.ui.UiElement<E>
      • de.esoco.process.ui.UiLayoutElement<E>
        • de.esoco.process.ui.UiLayout.ChildElement<UiLayout.Cell>
          • de.esoco.process.ui.UiLayout.Cell
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    UiFlexLayout.FlexCell
    Enclosing class:
    UiLayout

    public class UiLayout.Cell
extends UiLayout.ChildElement<UiLayout.Cell>
    A cell in a layout (at a crossing of a row and a column) that contains a single component. Depending on the layout type cells can be empty, i.e. their component may be NULL.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      protected Cell(UiLayout.Row rRow, UiLayout.Column rColumn)
      Creates a new instance of a cell that is placed at a certain layout position.

        This instance for fluent invocation

      • getColumn

        public UiLayout.Column getColumn()
        Returns the column of this cell. This method in intended for internal use by subclasses because it may return NULL before a layout has been applied to it's container. It is therefore recommended that Application code accesses rows and column only through the layout and not through the cell returned by a component.
        Returns:
        The column

      • getComponent

        public final UiComponent<?,?> getComponent()
        Returns the component that is placed in this cell. The cell of a layout will only contain a valid component reference after the layout has been applied to it's container.
        Returns:
        The component in this cell

      • getRow

        public UiLayout.Row getRow()
        Returns the row of this cell. This method in intended for internal use by subclasses because it may return NULL before a layout has been applied to it's container. It is therefore recommended that Application code accesses rows and column only through the layout and not through the cell returned by a component.
        Returns:
        The row

        public final boolean isEmpty()
        Checks whether this cell is empty (i.e. the component is NULL).

      • startNewRow

        public UiLayout.Cell startNewRow()
        Marks a cell to start a new layout row. This can be used as an alternative to UiLayout.nextRow(), for example when moving components with UiComponent.placeBefore(UiComponent).
        Returns:
        This instance for fluent invocation
